title: Optimizing Wireless Networks with Deep Unfolding: Comparative Study on Two Deep Unfolding Mechanisms
abstract: arXiv:2403.18930v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: In this work, we conduct a comparative study on two deep unfolding mechanisms to efficiently perform power control in the next generation wireless networks. The power control problem is formulated as energy efficiency over multiple interference links. The problem is nonconvex. We employ fractional programming transformation to design two solutions for the problem. The first solution is a numerical solution while the second solution is a closed-form solution. Based on the first solution, we design a semi-unfolding deep learning model where we combine the domain knowledge of the wireless communications and the recent advances in the data-driven deep learning. Moreover, on the highlights of the closed-form solution, fully deep unfolded deep learning model is designed in which we fully leveraged the expressive closed-form power control solution and deep learning advances. translated_title: 优化无线网络与深度展开：两种深度展开机制的比较研究
translated_abstract: 在这项工作中，我们对两种深度展开机制进行比较研究，以高效地进行下一代无线网络中的功率控制。功率控制问题被建模为多个干扰链接上的能量效率问题。该问题是非凸的。我们采用分数规划转换为该问题设计了两个解决方案。第一个解决方案是数值解，而第二个解决方案是闭式解。基于第一个解决方案，我们设计了一个半展开深度学习模型，其中我们结合了无线通信领域知识和数据驱动深度学习的最新进展。此外，基于闭式解的亮点，我们设计了一个完全展开的深度学习模型，在这个模型中充分利用了表达力强的闭式功率控制解和深度学习的进步。在仿真结果中，我们比较了所提出方法的性能。
tldr: 本论文进行了关于两种深度展开机制的比较研究，提出了一个半展开深度学习模型和一个完全展开的深度学习模型，以高效进行无线网络中的功率控制。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a comparative study on two deep unfolding mechanisms, proposing a semi-unfolding deep learning model and a fully deep unfolded deep learning model for efficient power control in wireless networks.
